CHANGE.ITEM: Added TEMPHEAD, checked ID, and added TYPEs to DIVs in order to validate. Checked for N=""s. Checked for GROUP tags. Proofed title page. Checked s. Reviewed structure; removed fragment of German introduction from beginning (placed in notes); changed sub HEAD to BYLINE; changed TRAILER to CLOSER; added two symbol GAPs; removed LIST LABEL ITEMs from three stanzas, and changed Ps to Ls. Checked placement and completeness of PBs. Checked for damage GAPs, #s, @s, --s, and UNCLEARs. Corrected [dollar]s. Checked for &cs with incorrect spacing. Checked for LBs. Checked for startqs and endqs, abq's, oes, qs, Ae's, and Qs. Checked proofsheets and made corrections. Checked italic I / J and U / V. Checked for missing page GAPs. Checked for EPIGRAPHs and ARGUMENTS. Checked CLOSERs, OPENERs, SIGNEDs, SALUTEs, TRAILERs, BYLINEs. Checked decorated initials. Checked FIGUREs. Sample: 2 minutes. Proofing: 0 minutes. Tag review and corrections: 50 minutes. DONE.

LG.L: Katereyn, þe curteys lies curteyst? of alle þat I know,
cumlyest kepyng kaytifs ffro kare,
Of lyth þou art lanterne to leche hem be-low,
to leede hem þat þe loue fro bales ful bare;
ffor no throng of no threte þou woldest not ouer-throw,
bot tholyd thykly thank of vs care, so Ms.
Qwen̄ þe tyraunt trayfoly walde turne þe, I trow,
with towchyng of turnement he tynt not to spare.
To spare þe he tynt þere,
Qwen he his myht mynt þere
To momyl on his mawment,
And for þou styfly stynte þere,
As fyre doth of flynt þere,
þi resons hym rent.
Katereyn with hyre resons þat rwd þus Ms. þus sche rent,
sche rowth not of his rialte, hir rewle was so rithe,
And so þat bostful belamy þat beerd so bent,
þat neþer bewte ne bonchif abode in his bythe.
þan to seke schofferes his sergauntes he sent,
to se, qwo schuld scort hyre sawes in his sythe,
ffyfti fyue Richtige zahl 50 retorikes in hast þei hem hent,
of clargy in kyngdames þe hyest were hythe.
Heyest were þei hythe þan
And most made of myth þan
Clergi to kepe.
He þe beerde bryth þan Ms. þon?
Soche poyntes hem pyth þan
To her lore þei lepe.
Katereyn þus ful lufly sche lawth to here lore,
lythly fyfty retorikes to lede in hyr lees,
Alle þei bowed hir blely & blessed hire I-bore
& bonde hem to hire biddyng be-fore al þe prees,
þan þat cursud cayfte was kyng þere I-core
commaund his commyneres cantly in rees,
To forme a fyre ferly his face þere be-fore,
alle þo fyfty fesawntys Ms. fesawntỳs in fyre to fees.
In fyre he wolde fees hem,
But al dyd hit plese hem,
ffor hurt hade þei none.
And for þei to ches hem,
No paryng to ples hem,
Was of on here a-lone.
Katereyn, wyttily þus þou wit wanne,
qwen þo wyȝthes at þi wyl here wordes had wonne,
þo þi rial resons to ryth so þei ranne,
y [k]now Ms. y now? þe reygn rially þat rewly ha[þ r]onne;
In mankynde so mytthyly was neuer mane
haþ fyfty wyȝthes be his worde so wittily wonne,
Qwere fore þat thef thankles thyrsted þe þane
& bad throw þe in a trowe thyk fro þe sonne.
Thyk in a trowe þus
He made his wow þus
þe too lies twelf?, so die richtige zahl. dayes to sitte;
To hym þe to low þus,
No mete he wil a-low þus
To turne þi wjtte.
To turne þi witte hym tarying þe tredyd þat traytour,
qwen þou were throw throghe, but trewþe þer þe tente,
Qwen a dentywos dowf made þe to dewre
& dyth þe fro derknes & solace þe sente.
Solace sothe þe soþly of oure sauyour,
qwen he saw þe in sorowes to save þin entent,
And shewd þe þe salf of his sokour,
qwen he seyed seemly: "for me þou schalt be schente.
For me þou schalt be blamyd,
Be not þer fore a-schamyd,
þe deth for to take!
And for þou schalt be famyd,
ffayre haue I framyd
A crowne for þi sake."
Katereyn for þi sake þe sothe þan for to sene
þe solas of þat savyour þat schap þe to schame,
Qwen pertly to Porfiri presed þe qwene
& prayed hym plese þe porter to se Katereyn fame.
þere þei com to Katereyn comly & clene,
to commen with þat curtays & knowen of hyre game,
Al bemus of briȝtnes abowt hyre þer beene
& with hire bawmyng of blis þo briddus sche brogth tame.
þo briddes brogth sche tame so,
Bothe quene & knyȝt be name so
To cristen beleue.
Qwen grace was hir game so,
No grymme myth hem grame so,
So dethe was hem leue.
Þat deth þat is derue here to dye not þei dowte,
qwen þei departe fro þat dere, sche drof þe fro drede.
No lenger sche þat was lost to hire lowe þan wold þei lowte,
bot longly lagowrid him with al his gret lede.
þan stode he a-stonyd sturdy Ms. sturdy. (mit punkt dahinter). & stowte,
he stranglyd hym selue, so he strof almost in dede,
And for his qwene schortly schamed not his schowte,
he schope hir to schrynk, qwen sche schuld blood schede.
Her blod sche did schede þo,
Qwen þei vnwrapped hir wede þo,
Hir pappes for to kerf;
Here myth was on hir mede þo,
þe swerde sche myth not fre[de] Ms. fre þo
þat hir hede schuld sterf.
Þus sterved þe qwene strongly of hym þat was sterne,
& now stif may sche not, so styfly f in styfly undeutlich sche stod.
þan Porphyri litthly, os loue gaue hym lerne,
he wonde hire wōwndyd in a wed & grof hire ful goode.
þere dredles þe deueles lym wax wondur derne
& dispised dedly to deel þer hys mode:
"Qwat bachilere was so bold a-wey hir to berene,
eyþer to beryen hir bones or hyr blode,
Hir bones & hir [blod] als
With mytthynes of mode als?"—
Porphiri sayde.
"Þat dede dyd I good als,
ffor I schuld feel hir fode als,
In graue I hir layede!"
Þan sprong þat cursed kayesere is lies with spere in hert sprunge, lies stunge?
he spared no speche to þe pepul fast for to spende,
He seyde his tene wi’ so Ms. hir for to tempure & to tellen with tunge,—
al þat his trw tutor wold no[t] t undeutlich entende.
"Allas", sayd þat caytyf, "qwat woo hath þe wrunge?
to wirkyn a-ȝens me, neuer I þe reende?
þou schalt for þi traytury to turment be slounge,
to fecchen alle þi ferys fro foly hem to fende!"
Fro foly þere he fende hym,
With mekenes to mende hym
To þe deth, qwen he went.
Euer Porphiri wende hym,
Goddys merci to mende hym,
ffor his heed was his rent.
Þan was lufly Katereyn lyft vp o-loft
& laȝgth fro þat low lake þat lurdeyn to lef.
He sayd to þat semly her sorowes for to soft:
"& send our syre þi sacrifice, no schame schal þe gref,
And j schal crowne þe in þe court of our goddesse croft,
& after my first chosyn j chese þe þe chef;
& bot þou folow þis fast, faynt schalt þou oft,
qwyles any fresch freþe, may feel þe to mef.
Qwyles þat þou meue mayst
And feel any greue mayst
With punchyng of peles,
Siþ not my god þou leue mayst,
Prestly þou preue mayst
Turnyng of qweles."
Wyth wrenchis & wylys þus wrogth he his wrake,
with a wondurful cast þat wiȝth to wynne;
Al here vertuuswerk for wychcraft was take,
for sche wrogth not his wille for sleyȝt ne for gynne.
þan made he þat mayden̄ his mynde for to make,
to medyl hire with mischef hir myȝth for to mynne
So slely þat sleyȝth so deuly was schake,
þat four thowsand of þat thref thyrst were ful thynne.
Qwan þat throng was thyn þan,
Disioyned was þat gyn þan
Selcouyth in syȝth.
Matrones more & many lies myn þan
With maydens wold not blyn þan
To wepe for þat wyȝth.
þan þat beerde briȝthest brast on a breyd,
to þo buntiful beerdes a-booue sche hem bilde,
To haue no pyte on hir peyne prestly sche preyd,
so al hir pert pouste in payne hit was pilde.
þan þat sory senatour sodanly seyd,
for sche so þo feres freschely had fylde:
Liȝthly with a swerd hire lyf schuld be leyd,
to lawnch þat lym̄ Ms. lym? l undeutlich. lusty, hir nek was ful milde.
As feythful to fynde here
And comly fulkynd here
Sche prayed for hir frendys,
þat, qwo so wold bynde hem so Ms., lies hem bynde. here,
To haue hire in mynde here,
To fende hem fro fendys.
An heylyng ful hendly Katereyn þer hente,
qwen he, þat was hyȝest, hyr orisoun herde
& seyd: "my dere derlyng, to trewth take entent,
for þei schal lif at þi lust, on þi loue haf lerede.
To save þe fulsone I am at a-sent,
to fende þe fro fyendys wald make þe a-ferde,
ffor alle þe meyne of myrþe hely haue mente,
to myrthe þe with melody, qwen myth hath þe merde.
Qwan merde haþ þe myȝth þus,
þe schol so Ms., lies schal. I lyȝth þus
fful hyȝe vp in heuen,
As semly in oure siȝth þus
Schalt þou rest o-riȝth þus
þour stiffenes of steuen!"
þan prestly þat prisonere hir nek forth sche pytte
& preuyd hir self purly, qwen peyne did [hir] prik.
ffersly with a faunchoun þat comly was kitte,
þat milk fro þat mayden throng þere ful thik.
þus was þe cors knytt of a kayftyf so Ms. vnknytt,
qwen fayntly sche foundyed as a flayn flik,
& as fresch fesaunt to hire fere þan sche flytt,
qwen sche was woundid vn-worthi as woful & wik.
þan þat flik flayn newe
Angeles ful fayn newe
Hir body þei fett,
With myȝth & with mayn newe
Hir þat was slayn newe
In Syna þei sett.
To Syna ful scherply sothly þei flye,
qwen þei hadd fet þat feþiful farly to feel.
To Crist for þat curteys comly þei crye,
for þei knew wele þat Katereyn our karis schuld h(e)re keel.
Myȝtthily o þat mount with melodye
þei mynt for to myrthe vs at euere ilk a meel,
þere fore thanke hyre to herborgh hye,
qwer fro hire realy oyl riueres rennes Ms. reu̇es (= reueres?). reel.
Oyl releþ oft so
ffro hir vp o-loft so
Sekenes to socure;
þus salf fro hir soft so
Commeth fro hir croft so
Hir to honoure.
þis peyne þat sche preuyd—j rede, þou it pondur,
þat sche put þe fro prisoun, qwere peyne is ful prest,
ffor alle þat hire worchipes sche wardeþ hem with wondur
& reuleþ hem be resoun þat recheþ hem to rest.
Qwen þou tretest in tempest of hayl or of thondur,
sche koueres þe kyndly fro kares þe to kest
& sendys þe surauns þi sorowes for to sondur
& brynges þe to bonchef þi bales to brest.
Fro balys to blysse þor
Wytty sche wysse þor
þat haue hire in mynde.
No myȝth may sche misse þor,
ffor Crist graunt hir þisse þor,
Qwere sche was pynde.
K Kepe hem here, Katereyn, al þat þe calle
& kache hem fro kares, qwen þei krepen in klay,
a & hem, þat are of Adam here alle,
fro þe aungeles of angwysch þou awtur hem ay!
t Turne a-way al trayt[o]ures, Ms. trayt{ur}es. turtyl so talle,
þat towchyn vs with turmentys of tene & of tray,
e Euer entrik þou our enmyes to falle,
entyr þou oure heraudys to Crist euere-I-day!
r Reche vs blysse blyth þer,
i Ientyl in loue liþ þer,
Oure foos for to fende!
n Now swynk þou for vs swith þere,
a Ay kyndnes to hiẏ so Ms., ? = hiþ. þere,
Oure myrthys for to mende!
Ri Ryal þou reyngnest, qwere ryalte is ryf,
& rewlyst hem þat berwd & redyn on þe rent.
car Carpyng of þi curtesy kep vs fro þat cnyf
þat cursurdly karueth vs, qwen we to synne sent.
d Dyntes of deuelys dere fro vs dryue,
þat doluyn ben in derckenesse deply a dent.
vs Vs qwich of his vertues, qwere þou art wyffe,
þat wyȝthly wroȝgth al, with qwom þou art went.
With qwom þou art went now,
Heel þou vs hent now,
Virgyn so cleen!
Her bales mayst þou blent now
To lerne þe a-sent now,
Son̄ beem so scheen!
S Schere a-way charp schowres þat schap vs to schrik
& schaf a-wey chames þat schrunk be in schenchip!
pal Pales vs with pyte & pride fro vs pik,
put vs fro þis pouert & put vs to wirchip,
d Draw vs to þi dyngnite fro þis depe dyk
& to þi dentiwos dool qwere deieþ euer demschip!
y Ioyne vs to Iesu, þat chesus so Ms., = ches us. hym lyk,
chef of our iornay we chees euer þi frenchip:
n Now þi frenchip to fynde ay,
g God on þe make our mynde ay,
Oure mede to encresse!
þo pynchars vs haf pynd ay,
þou kille hem Kateryn̄ kynd ay
And profor vs þi pesse!
I grete þe, most gracyous, to governe hem al
þat geder þe to hir giyld, hem for to gyde.
ffeed vs feer fayful, þat vs no foly fal,
for seynthed & freelte we feel vs be-syde!
Saue þou our sawles synful, qwen þei a-pere schal
& with vs to þi wonnyng fro þis woo wyde
To þat kyng þat is kyndest, Katereyne, vs cal,
þat born was our broþur, in blis we to a-byde!
Katereyne to þat kyng vs
þat on crosse for hyng vs
Vs alle mut þou wysse!
To þat blisse so Ms. he bryng vs,
Qwere aungeles schul syng vs
With joye & with blysse!

DIV1.HEAD: Hymne auf die fünf freuden der Maria.
Scā Maria.

LG.L: [M]yldyste of moode & mekyst of maydyns alle,
O modyrs mercyfullyst, most chast þat euer was wyfe,
Worschypfullyst of women þat were ȝet be or schalle,
Parfytst of x x x x x Vor prayowre mehrere kreuze auf Rasur und ein zeichen . prayowre þe best þat euyr bare lyve,
Whose salutacyon was fyrste Ioye of thy fyve,
Whan Gabriel seyde "hayle, Mary, ful of grace",
Wyth þe wheche worde þe holy gost as blyue
Wyth yn þi chest hath chosyn a ioyful place.
[A] secunde Ioy hadyst þou, whan Cryst Iesu
Of þe was borne, & ȝet was þou a mayde,
ffor company of man thou nevyr knewe;
Chylde forth þou brynge but with wordes þat wer sayde
Of þe aungel, whom of þou wher a-frayde,
Tyll he seyde: "Mary, Ms. Mary dere (also dere ungültig). loke, þou drede nowte,
Plucke vp thyn herte, and be no thyng dysmayde,
ffor thys hye werke almyghty god hatħ wrowte.
[R]ysyn from dethe to lyf that ys eterne
Ys thy swete son ascend vp on hye,
In to a trone above the stremyng sterren,
Wher aungellys syng a-bowte þe chererchy,
Lovyng þat lorde wyth heuynly melody
As kyng of kynges whose rengne schal euer endure."
Lo gracious lady and modyr of mercy,
Thys was thyrde ioy of thy blest auenture.
[I]n solempne wyse assumptyd wyth a songe
Of cherubyn, thy forthe ioy to atteyne,
Was þi body and thy sowle aungellys a-monge
Vnto thy son browte vp yn Febus wayne,
Wher personys three yn .O. god sytte certeyne, Ms. certeyte
Of whose presens ryght ioyful mayste thow be;
ffor as scrypture in holy bokys sayn:
Thow conceyuydyst clene that holy trinite.
[A]nde they alle three of on affeccion
Haue chosy[n] the cheffe, te so Ms. quene for to be
Of heyvyn and erthe, wos coronacione
Was thy fyrste ioy wyth grete solempnyte.
Now blyste lady, flowre of uirginite,
Graunt vs thy grace oure lyvys to a-men[d],
That we may come here aftyr Ms. astyr vnto the
Vnto þat ioye whyche nevyr schal haue ende.
Pryncesse, pray to thy sone,
In worschyp of þi salutacyon,
Perpetually þat we may wone
Wyth hym yn hys hy domynacione,
Euyr lastyng to lyue yn þat Ms. yt? t un∣deutlich! mancione—
Lady graunt vs thys sayde supplycacione!
